title: Strictly's Rose Ayling-Ellis rehearsing without hearing music
description: Rose Ayling-Ellis and her dance partner Giovanni Pernice prepare for their first live performance.

title: Gas crisis leaves Europe searching for solutions
description: Consumers face a steep rise in energy bills as governments try to fund the move to renewable energy.

title: Migrants freezing to death on Belarus-Poland border
description: The BBC finds stranded migrants facing sub-zero temperatures amid a row between Poland and Belarus.

title: Homeless in London: 'People pretend they are not there'
description: Photographer Anthony Dawton has been documenting London's homeless population during the pandemic.

title: Spying concerns fuel the market for more secure tech
description: Revelations about spyware have spurred interest in more secure phones and software.

title: Labour conference: Party pledges to cap foreign sales of new homes
description: The party will set out the plan at its annual conference, arguing it will help first-time buyers.

title: Canary Islands volcano: 'Miracle house' escapes lava
description: The volcano on La Palma has been erupting since Sunday, destroying hundreds of homes.

title: Man's hidden Hornby model railway collection fetches £21k
description: Adrian Batty's wife says she had no idea her late husband had amassed hundreds of rare models.

title: University students looking forward to full campus experience
description: There is a buzz on the University of East Anglia campus as face-to-face teaching resumes.

title: Why is there a CO2 shortage and how will it hit food supplies?
description: The UK's food industry has been told it must pay five times more for carbon dioxide in future.

title: Woman with Down's loses abortion law fight
description: Heidi Crowter says the current law on abortion for foetuses with the condition does not respect her life.

title: Wallaby escapes from petting zoo into Aberdeenshire countryside
description: Eddie, who is about six months old, escaped the day after arriving and was last seen outside a village pub.

title: EU rules to force USB-C chargers for all phones
description: Manufacturers could be forced to change devices to a uniform charging port.

title: Former Labour MP Keith Vaz faces Parliament ban over bullying staff member
description: The former Labour MP should be ashamed of his behaviour, an independent panel says.

title: Police investigating if stranger killed Sabina Nessa
description: The teacher had been on her way to meet a friend but was killed shortly after leaving home.

title: Homecoming for Raducanu to be shown live on BBC
description: A homecoming event for US Open champion Emma Raducanu will be shown live on the BBC on Friday.

title: Millions face winter finance squeeze, says charity
description: Low-income families face a £710 rise in costs, the Joseph Rowntree Foundation estimates.

title: Rugby World Cup winner Thompson to donate brain for CTE research
description: Rugby World Cup winner Steve Thompson, who was diagnosed with dementia aged 42, will donate his brain to scientists researching brain trauma.

title: Energy firms' collapse hits 1.5 million customers
description: The government is understood to have cooled on supporting big energy firms with state-backed loans.

title: 'Side-eyeing Chloe' Clem to sell iconic meme as NFT
description: The image of Chloe Clem could fetch her tens of thousands of dollars at auction.

title: Working from home: Staff abuse it, says City boss
description: Staff should not have the right to ask for flexible working from day one of new job, an employer says.

title: Boris Johnson at the UN fact-checked
description: The prime minister's speech focused largely on climate change and the UK's role in tackling it.

title: Uefa doubles prize money for women's Euros
description: Uefa doubles the prize money available to teams for the women's European Championship in 2022.

title: Covid debt: A baby, job loss - and now eviction
description: Tenants are being evicted due to rent arrears built up during the pandemic, an investigation finds.

title: Australian PM Morrison says 'no special deals' for families of England's Ashes players
description: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison says there will be "no special deals" after Boris Johnson asks for families of England cricketers to be allowed to travel for the Ashes.

title: Boris Johnson: Humanity is reaching a turning point on climate change
description: World leaders must make major changes in four areas - "coal, cars, cash and trees", Boris Johnson says.

title: Victorian ticket ledger found at March railway station
description: The luggage ledger dates back to April 1885, when the railway station opened.

title: 'It's been a long time waiting' - everything you need to know about 43rd Ryder Cup
description: Three years after Europe regained the Ryder Cup in Paris, the US finally have their opportunity to avenge that thrashing in front of a partisan home crowd in Wisconsin.

title: The Papers: 'Winter of woe' and France rift deepens
description: The ongoing gas crisis and France's anger over a new UK-US-Australia military pact make the front pages.

title: 'Giving birth left me needing a colostomy bag'
description: Former triathlete Kayleigh Adams endured a fourth-degree tear that led to her needing a colostomy bag.

title: Covid: How can missing five million be persuaded to have the jab?
description: Headlines have focused on teenagers and booster doses - but millions still haven't had a first jab.

title: Angela Merkel: Four expert verdicts on a contested legacy
description: When the German chancellor steps down, how will history remember her? Four experts have their say.

title: Grim echoes of history in images of Haitians at US-Mexico border
description: Pictures of border officers rounding up black men have drawn comparisons to US slave patrols.

title: Johnson and Biden: Contrasting characters do business
description: No major gaffes and progress on climate change on PM's US trip but a trade deal remains a distant prospect.
